DCWF_621.role_description: Executes software planning, requirements, risk management, design, development, architecture, modeling, estimation, configuration management, quality, security, and tests using software development methodologies, architectural structures, viewpoints, styles, design decisions, and frameworks across all lifecycle phases.

DCWF_632.role_description: Designs, develops, tests, and evaluates information systems throughout the systems development lifecycle.

DCWF_421.role_description: Administers databases and/or data management systems that allow for the storage, query, and utilization of data.

DCWF_802.role_description: Work that involves directly managing information technology projects to provide a unique service or product.

DCWF_651.role_description: Develops and maintains business, systems, and information processes to support enterprise mission needs; develops information technology (IT) rules and requirements that describe baseline and target architectures.

DCWF_621_408.description: Analyze information to determine, recommend, and plan the development of a new application or modification of an existing application.

DCWF_621_414.description: Analyze user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints.

DCWF_621_417.description: Apply coding and testing standards, apply security testing tools including "fuzzing" static-analysis code scanning tools, and conduct code reviews.

DCWF_621_432.description: Capture security controls used during the requirements phase to integrate security within the process, to identify key security objectives, and to maximize software security while minimizing disruption to plans and schedules.

DCWF_621_446.description: Compile and write documentation of program development and subsequent revisions, inserting comments in the coded instructions so others can understand the program.

DCWF_621_459A.description: Conduct trial runs of programs and software applications to ensure the desired information is produced and instructions and security levels are correct.

DCWF_621_461.description: Confer with systems analysts, engineers, programmers, and others to design application and to obtain information on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements, and interfaces.

DCWF_621_467.description: Consult with engineering staff to evaluate interface between hardware and software.

DCWF_621_477.description: Correct errors by making appropriate changes and rechecking the program to ensure desired results are produced.

DCWF_621_506.description: Design, develop, and modify software systems, using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcome and consequences of design.

DCWF_621_515A.description: Develop software system testing and validation procedures, programming, and documentation.

DCWF_621_543.description: Develop secure code and error handling.

DCWF_621_602.description: Evaluate factors such as reporting formats required, cost constraints, and need for security restrictions to determine hardware configuration.

DCWF_621_634.description: Identify basic common coding flaws at a high level.

DCWF_621_644.description: Identify security implications and apply methodologies within centralized and decentralized environments across the enterprises computer systems in software development.

DCWF_621_645.description: Identify security issues around steady state operation and management of software and incorporate security measures that must be taken when a product reaches its end of life.

DCWF_621_709A.description: Modify and maintain existing software to correct errors, to adapt it to new hardware, or to upgrade interfaces and improve performance.

DCWF_621_756.description: Perform integrated quality assurance testing for security functionality and resiliency attack.

DCWF_621_764.description: Perform secure programming and identify potential flaws in codes to mitigate vulnerabilities.

DCWF_621_770.description: Perform risk analysis (e.g., threat, vulnerability, and probability of occurrence) whenever an application or system undergoes a major change.

DCWF_621_850.description: Store, retrieve, and manipulate data for analysis of system capabilities and requirements.

DCWF_621_865.description: Translate security requirements into application design elements including documenting the elements of the software attack surfaces, conducting threat modeling, and defining any specific security criteria.

DCWF_621_970A.description: Apply cybersecurity functions (e.g., encryption, access control, and identity management) to reduce exploitation opportunities.

DCWF_621_972A.description: Determine and document software patches or the extent of releases that would leave software vulnerable.

DCWF_621_1149A.description: Enable applications with public keying by leveraging existing public key infrastructure (PKI) libraries and incorporating certificate management and encryption functionalities when appropriate.

DCWF_621_1150A.description: Identify and leverage the enterprise-wide security services while designing and developing secure applications (e.g., Enterprise PKI, Federated Identity server, Enterprise AV solution) when appropriate.

DCWF_621_785.description: Prepare detailed workflow charts and diagrams that describe input, output, and logical operation, and convert them into a series of instructions coded in a computer language.

DCWF_621_826.description: Address security implications in the software acceptance phase including completion criteria, risk acceptance and documentation, common criteria, and methods of independent testing.

DCWF_621_971.description: Design countermeasures and mitigations against potential exploitations of programming language weaknesses and vulnerabilities in system and elements.

DCWF_621_1151.description: Identify and leverage the enterprise-wide version control system while designing and developing secure applications.

DCWF_621_2156.description: Consult with customers about software system design and maintenance.

DCWF_621_2335.description: Direct software programming and development of documentation.

DCWF_621_2839.description: Supervise and assign work to programmers, designers, technologists and technicians, and other engineering and scientific personnel.

DCWF_621_5200.description: Design, implement, test, and evaluate secure interfaces between information systems, physical systems, and/or embedded technologies.

DCWF_621_726.description: Oversee and make recommendations regarding configuration management.

DCWF_632_999C.description: Collaborate on cybersecurity professionals to implement cybersecurity into designs to meet specific operational needs and environmental factors (e.g., access controls, automated applications, networked operations, high integrity and availability requirements, multilevel security/processing of multiple classification levels, and processing Sensitive Compartmented Information).

DCWF_632_500B.description: Design hardware, operating systems, or software applications to adequately address requirements.

DCWF_632_530A.description: Develop detailed design documentation for component and interface specifications to support system design and development.

DCWF_632_1000A.description: Ensure design and development activities are properly documented (providing a functional description of implementation) and updated as necessary.

DCWF_632_659A.description: Implement designs for new or existing system(s).

DCWF_632_416A.description: Analyze design constraints, analyze trade-offs and security design, and consider lifecycle support.

DCWF_632_998A.description: Analyze user needs and requirements to plan and conduct system development.

DCWF_632_431A.description: Build, assess, and modify product prototypes using working models or theoretical models.

DCWF_632_5110.description: Conduct a market analysis to identify, assess, and recommend commercial, GOTS, and open source products for use within a system and ensure recommended products are in compliance with organization's evaluation and validation requirements.

DCWF_632_494.description: Design and develop cybersecurity or cybersecurity-enabled products.

DCWF_632_5190.description: Design and develop system administration and management functionality for privileged access users.

DCWF_632_501.description: Design or integrate appropriate data backup capabilities into overall system designs, and ensure appropriate technical and procedural processes exist for secure system backups and protected storage of backup data.

DCWF_632_503A.description: Design to security requirements to ensure requirements are met for all systems and/or applications.

DCWF_632_5200A.description: Design, implement, assess, and evaluate secure interfaces between information systems, physical systems, and/or embedded technologies.

DCWF_632_516A.description: Develop testing and validation procedures and documentation.

DCWF_632_527.description: Develop architectures or system components consistent with technical specifications.

DCWF_632_999A.description: Develop designs to meet specific operational needs and environmental factors (e.g., access controls, automated applications, networked operations.

DCWF_632_531.description: Develop Disaster Recovery and Continuity of Operations plans for systems under development and ensure testing prior to systems entering a production environment.

DCWF_632_542B.description: Develop risk mitigation strategies and cybersecurity countermeasures to address cost, performance, and security risks and to resolve vulnerabilities and recommend security changes to system or system components as needed.

DCWF_632_630.description: Identify and direct the remediation of technical problems encountered during testing and implementation of new systems (e.g., identify and find work-arounds for communication protocols that are not interoperable).

DCWF_632_632.description: Identify and prioritize essential system functions or sub-systems required to support essential capabilities or business functions for restoration or recovery after a system failure or during a system recovery event based on overall system requirements for continuity and availability.

DCWF_632_626A.description: Identify components or elements, allocate comprehensive functional components to include security functions, and describe the relationships between the elements.

DCWF_632_648.description: Identify, assess, and recommend cybersecurity or cybersecurity-enabled products for use within a system and ensure recommended products are in compliance with organization's evaluation and validation requirements.

DCWF_632_1152A.description: Implement and integrate systems engineering methodologies into development environment.

DCWF_632_5400.description: Incorporates risk-driven systems maintenance updates process to address system deficiencies (periodically and out of cycle).

DCWF_632_770.description: Perform risk analysis (e.g., threat, vulnerability, and probability of occurrence) whenever an application or system undergoes a major change.

DCWF_632_766A.description: Perform security reviews and identify security gaps in architecture.

DCWF_632_803.description: Provide guidelines for implementing developed systems to customers or installation teams.

DCWF_632_808B.description: Provide input to implementation plans, standard operating procedures, maintenance documentation, and maintenance training materials

DCWF_632_809.description: Provide input to the Risk Management Framework process activities and related documentation (e.g., system life-cycle support plans, concept of operations, operational procedures, and maintenance training materials).

DCWF_632_856A.description: Provide support to test and evaluation activities.

DCWF_632_850.description: Store, retrieve, and manipulate data for analysis of system capabilities and requirements.

DCWF_632_860A.description: Trace system requirements to design components and perform gap analysis.

DCWF_632_874.description: Utilize models and simulations to analyze or predict system performance under different operating conditions.

DCWF_632_877A.description: Verify stability, interoperability, portability, and/or scalability of system architecture.

DCWF_632_602.description: Evaluate factors such as reporting formats required, cost constraints, and need for security restrictions to determine hardware configuration.

DCWF_421_5890.description: Identify data consolidation opportunities across database systems, including data sharing and access between business lines.

DCWF_421_815.description: Provide recommendations on new database technologies and architectures.

DCWF_421_401.description: Analyze and plan for anticipated changes in data capacity requirements.

DCWF_421_664A.description: Install and configure database management systems and software.

DCWF_421_712.description: Monitor and maintain databases to ensure optimal performance.

DCWF_421_740.description: Perform backup and recovery of databases to ensure data integrity.

DCWF_421_1154.description: Perform configuration management, problem management, capacity management, and financial management for databases and data management systems.

DCWF_421_520A.description: Implement data mining and data warehousing applications.

DCWF_421_1155.description: Support incident management, service level management, change management, release management, continuity management, and availability management for databases and data management systems.

DCWF_802_5010.description: Act as a primary stakeholder in the underlying information technology (IT) operational processes and functions that support the service, provide direction and monitor all significant activities so the service is delivered successfully.

DCWF_802_5150.description: Coordinate and manage the overall service provided to a customer end-to-end.

DCWF_802_537.description: Develop methods to monitor and measure risk, compliance, and assurance efforts.

DCWF_802_1018.description: Ensure all acquisitions, procurements, and outsourcing efforts address information security requirements consistent with organization goals.

DCWF_802_1148B.description: Ensure supply chain, system, network, performance, and cyber security requirements are included in contract language and delivered.

DCWF_802_5310.description: Ensure that appropriate SLAs and underpinning contracts have been defined that clearly set out for the customer a description of the service and the measures for monitoring the service.

DCWF_802_949.description: Evaluate the effectiveness of procurement function in addressing information security requirements and supply chain risks through procurement activities and recommend improvements.

DCWF_802_5380.description: Gather feedback on customer satisfaction and internal service performance to foster continual improvement.

DCWF_802_680A.description: Lead and oversee budget, staffing, and contracting.

DCWF_802_5410.description: Manage the internal relationship with information technology (IT) process owners supporting the service, assisting with the definition and agreement of operating level agreements (OLAs).

DCWF_802_1017A.description: Participate in the acquisition process as necessary.

DCWF_802_760.description: Perform needs analysis to determine opportunities for new and improved business process solutions.

DCWF_802_797.description: Provide advice on project costs, design concepts, or design changes.

DCWF_802_811.description: Provide ongoing optimization and problem solving support.

DCWF_802_813.description: Provide recommendations for possible improvements and upgrades.

DCWF_802_840B.description: Review or conduct audits of programs and projects.

DCWF_802_5610.description: Review service performance reports identifying any significant issues and variances, initiating, where necessary, corrective actions and ensuring that all outstanding issues are followed up.

DCWF_802_5660.description: Work with other service managers and product owners to balance and prioritize services to meet overall customer requirements, constraints, and objectives.

DCWF_802_1143A.description: Conduct import/export reviews for acquiring systems and software.

DCWF_802_1003.description: Develop and document supply chain risks for critical system elements, as appropriate.

DCWF_802_1148A.description: Develop supply chain, system, network, performance, and cyber security requirements.

DCWF_802_955A.description: Draft and publish supply chain security and risk management documents.

DCWF_802_629A.description: Identify and address cyber workforce planning and management issues (e.g. recruitment, retention, and training).

DCWF_802_801.description: Provide enterprise cybersecurity and supply chain risk management guidance for development of the Continuity of Operations Plans.

DCWF_802_834.description: Resolve conflicts in laws, regulations, policies, standards, or procedures.

DCWF_651_413A.description: Analyze user needs and requirements to plan architecture.

DCWF_651_502B.description: Develop enterprise architecture required to meet user needs.

DCWF_651_569A.description: Document and update as necessary all definition and architecture activities.

DCWF_651_579.description: Ensure acquired or developed system(s) and architecture(s) are consistent with organization's cybersecurity architecture guidelines.

DCWF_651_631.description: Identify and prioritize critical business functions in collaboration with organizational stakeholders.

DCWF_651_780A.description: Plan implementation strategy to ensure enterprise components can be integrated and aligned.

DCWF_651_2014.description: Analyze candidate architectures, allocate security services, and select security mechanisms.

DCWF_651_483A.description: Captures and integrates essential system capabilities or business functions required for partial or full system restoration after a catastrophic failure event.

DCWF_651_484.description: Define appropriate levels of system availability based on critical system functions and ensure system requirements identify appropriate disaster recovery and continuity of operations requirements to include any appropriate fail-over/alternate site requirements, backup requirements, and material supportability requirements for system recover/restoration.

DCWF_651_994A.description: Document how the implementation of a new system or new interface between systems impacts the current and target environment including but not limited to security posture.

DCWF_651_2390.description: Evaluate security architectures and designs to determine the adequacy of security design and architecture proposed or provided in response to requirements contained in acquisition documents.

DCWF_651_996B.description: Integrate key management functions as related to cyberspace.

DCWF_651_765A.description: Integrate results regarding the identification of gaps in security architecture.

DCWF_651_797.description: Provide advice on project costs, design concepts, or design changes.

DCWF_651_809.description: Provide input to the Risk Management Framework process activities and related documentation (e.g., system life-cycle support plans, concept of operations, operational procedures, and maintenance training materials).

DCWF_651_1147A.description: Develop data management capabilities (e.g., cloud based, centralized cryptographic key management) to include support to the mobile workforce.

DCWF_651_864A.description: Translate proposed capabilities into technical requirements.

DCWF_651_2887.description: Write detailed functional specifications that document the architecture development process.

DCWF_651_602.description: Evaluate factors such as reporting formats required, cost constraints, and need for security restrictions to determine hardware configuration.
